similar_project_experience.project_description: This 10-acre public safety campus integrates a Police Headquarters, 911 dispatch, and Fire Station, emphasizing architectural details that reflect city strength and community connection. A utilitarian Support Building complements operational needs. 80,000 SF | $59.3M | Project Director

Master planned as the first phase of a public safety campus, the new police station includes 911 Communication & Dispatch, Evidence & Property, Storm Shelter, Training, Office & Administration, Interview Rooms, SWAT Facilities, and Community Rooms. 23,150 SF | $12.5M | Project Director

Constructed in 1943 with an Art Deco appearance, Henderson City Hall faces space constraints, prompting a Feasibility Study by BRW to explore options for expansion. Given the historical significance and limitations of the existing building, the solution for Henderson was a stand alone annex building. 2,200 SF | $1M | Project Architect

The Service Center, damaged by a December 2022 tornado, prompted swift temporary repairs for Fleet Services. A March 2023 drawing package outlines roof repairs. Design considerations enhance functionality, favoring a reviewed floor plan for optimal accessibility and support spaces. 38,000 SF | $16M | Principal-in-Charge

A new Public Safety Building was constructed to house the growing Police Department, address security concerns, and serve as a symbolic landmark gateway to the historic city. Situated on a 5-acre site, the Police Station is designed with future growth in mind, prioritizing the mental and physical wellness of officers and staff. 36,700 SF | $19M | Project Director

similar_project_experience.project_description: BRW designed a new City Hall, replacing the existing 1978 structure. Departments with public interaction are consolidated on the first floor while a large conference room and centralized break room are featured on the second floor to foster employee camaraderie. An efficient and safe workplace will be ensured with restricted public access. 39,500 SF | $22M | Subject Matter Expert

BRW conducted a study for the city, evaluating their municipal complex and proposing solutions for optimal facility use. After thorough analysis and stakeholder consultations, the recommendation included constructing a new City Hall and repurposing the former senior center into a City Council Chamber and Municipal Court Building. 30,549 SF | $15M | Subject Matter Expert

Following a feasibility study, BRW constructed the new City Hall and Court Facility. Strategically designed to incorporate a future Police Station, the facility emphasizes shared spaces and is built to withstand hurricane-force winds of up to 130 miles per hour, offering a comprehensive solution for the city's municipal needs. 14,521 SF | $3.3M | Subject Matter Expert

BRW conducted a Feasibility Study for San Patricio County, aiming to alleviate overcrowding in the County Courthouse. The study identified the need for a new Courts Annex Building and the renovation of the existing County Courthouse to accommodate court security, procedure, and operational/spatial requirements. 115,000 SF | $50M | Subject Matter Expert

Much needed renovations and updates to the City Hall while preserving the historic character of the interior. A new public plaza and parking were also added to the site. 38,134 SF | $500K | Subject Matter Expert
